title: Emma Watson becomes Disney princess at Beauty and the Beast premiere despite needing a hand with beautiful gown
text:

Emma Watson transformed into a real life Disney princess at the Beauty and the Beast premiere in London this week. 
The former Harry Potter actress led the way in a stunning gown at the screening on Thursday night - and she burst out laughing as someone had to help rearrange the flowing dress as it trailed across the ground. 
Emma - who plays Belle in the live action adaptation of the popular animated classic - glowed and looked totally glamorous in the beautiful gown, even with the last minute adjustments in front of the cameras. Emma Watson gets a helping hand at the premiere (Photo: PA) She looked every inch the Disney princess (Photo: FilmMagic) Making a majestic exit (Photo: FilmMagic) 
She was joined by her co-stars at the glitzy premiere, and posed for a snap with her on-screen 'Beast' Dan Stevens. Read More 
The leading man looked very dapper in a sharp blue suit as he posed against a magical backdrop. Emma Watson and Dan Stevens (Photo: FilmMagic) The dress had to be totally on show (Photo: Rex Features) Emma looked incredible (Photo: Rex Features) 
The cast of the new, modern take on Disney's timeless film were all on hand for the screening and seemed to be in great spirits. Read More 
Mrs. Potts actress Emma Thompson was beaming, while Nathan Mack (Chip) looked very smart - and movie royalty Sir Ian McKellen (Cogsworth) added a dash of colour to his outfit with a pink scarf. Emma Thompson beamed at the event (Photo: FilmMagic) Nathan Mack looked very smart (Photo: FilmMagic) Sir Ian McKellan added a flash of colour (Photo: Rex Features) 
Also seen at the premiere were Luke Evans (Gaston) and Stanley Tucci, who will play Candenza the grand piano. Luke Evans couldn't stop smiling (Photo: FilmMagic) Stanley Tucci kept up the classy theme (Photo: FilmMagic) 
Speaking recently about the movie, Emma said: "What's so beautiful about this story as a whole is this idea that Belle is able to see past these extraneous, external, superficial qualities of Beast. 
"She is able to see deeper, and that's one of her special powers. It's her superpower: empathy." Like us on Facebook
